inputs.name: CheckmarxService
inputs.label: Checkmarx Endpoint
inputs.helpMarkDown: The CX server endpoint.

inputs.name: projectName
inputs.label: Project Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Either select an existing project name or type a name to create a new scan project

inputs.name: preset
inputs.label: Preset
inputs.helpMarkDown: predefined sets of queries that you can select when Creating, Configuring and Branching Projects. Predefined presets are provided by Checkmarx and you can configure your own. You can also import and export presets (on the server).

inputs.name: customPreset
inputs.label: Custom Preset
inputs.helpMarkDown: Custom presets are provided in cases where the desired preset is missing from the Checkmarx presets above. Leave empty in order to use a Checkmarx defined preset. In case a custom preset is selected, it will override the Checkmarx preset.

inputs.name: fullTeamName
inputs.label: Team
inputs.helpMarkDown: The full team name (for example, CxServer\SP\Company\Users).

inputs.name: incScan
inputs.label: Incremental Scan
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set true for incremental scan. If no scan was done yet, the scan will be a full scan and the following ones will be incremental.

inputs.name: folderExclusion
inputs.label: Folder Exclusion
inputs.helpMarkDown: Comma delineated list of the folders to exclude from the scan (for example: dto,target,WEB-INF)

inputs.name: fileExtension
inputs.label: Include/Exclude File Extensions
inputs.helpMarkDown: Comma separated list of include or exclude wildcard patterns. Exclude patterns start with exclamation mark "!" [Exclusion Example: !*.tmp, !*.html.   Inclusion Example: *.java ]

inputs.name: syncMode
inputs.label: Synchronous Mode
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enabling this option will cause the build step to wait for scan results, you can see the scan results inside the Checkmarx plug-in results window. If disabled, the results are only displayed inside the Checkmarx web-application

inputs.name: vulnerabilityThreshold
inputs.label: Enable CxSAST Vulnerability Thresholds
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set the maximum number of CxSAST vulnerabilities of given severity before the scan fails (Only available if synchronous mode is enabled)

inputs.name: high
inputs.label: CxSAST High
inputs.helpMarkDown: Define a threshold for the high severity vulnerabilities. The build will be marked as failed  if the number of the high severity vulnerabilities is larger than the threshold.

inputs.name: medium
inputs.label: CxSAST Medium
inputs.helpMarkDown: Define a threshold for the medium severity vulnerabilities. The build will be marked as failed  if the number of the medium severity vulnerabilities is larger than the threshold. Threshold must be 0 or greater to set a threshold, or leave blank for no thresholds

inputs.name: low
inputs.label: CxSAST Low
inputs.helpMarkDown: Define a threshold for the low severity vulnerabilities. The build will be marked as failed  if the number of the low severity vulnerabilities is larger than the threshold.  Threshold must be 0 or greater to set a threshold, or leave blank for no thresholds

inputs.name: osaEnabled
inputs.label: Enable CxOSA Scan
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enable the CxOSA option to initiate Open Source Analysis for this scan/job. Disabled by default.

inputs.name: osaFolderExclusions
inputs.label: CxOSA Folder Exclusions
inputs.helpMarkDown: Comma separated list of the folders to exclude from OSA scan (for example: dto,target,WEB-INF)

inputs.name: osaFileExclusions
inputs.label: CxOSA Include/Exclude wildcard patterns
inputs.helpMarkDown: Comma separated list of include or exclude wildcard patterns. Exclude patterns start with exclamation mark "!".

inputs.name: osaArchiveInclude
inputs.label: CxOSA Archive Extract Extensions
inputs.helpMarkDown: Comma separated list of archive wildcard patterns to include their extracted content for the scan. eg. *.zip, *.jar, *.ear. Supported archive types are: jar, war, ear, sca, gem, whl, egg, tar, tar.gz, tgz, zip, rar. Leave blank to extract all archives.

inputs.name: osaVulnerabilityThreshold
inputs.label: Enable CxOSA Vulnerability Thresholds
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set the maximum number of CxOSA vulnerabilities of given severity before the scan fails (Only available if synchronous mode is enabled)

inputs.name: osaHigh
inputs.label: CxOSA High
inputs.helpMarkDown: Define a threshold for the high severity vulnerabilities. The build will be marked as failed  if the number of the high severity vulnerabilities is larger than the threshold. Threshold must be 0 or greater to set a threshold, or leave blank for no thresholds

inputs.name: osaMedium
inputs.label: CxOSA Medium
inputs.helpMarkDown: Define a threshold for the medium severity vulnerabilities. The build will be marked as failed  if the number of the medium severity vulnerabilities is larger than the threshold. Threshold must be 0 or greater to set a threshold, or leave blank for no thresholds

inputs.name: osaLow
inputs.label: CxOSA Low
inputs.helpMarkDown: Define a threshold for the low severity vulnerabilities. The build will be marked as failed  if the number of the low severity vulnerabilities is larger than the threshold. Threshold must be 0 or greater to set a threshold, or leave blank for no thresholds
